title: Israelis still protest legal overhaul despite suspension
description: Tens of thousands of Israelis are protesting a controversial plan to revamp the country’s legal system, despite Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s suspension of the changes earlier in the week

title: Drug trafficking blamed as homicides soar in Costa Rica
description: Costa Rica logged a record 657 homicides last year

title: Police recover bodies of eight people in Canada near U.S. border
description: Police in the Mohawk Territory of Akwesasne said they believed the individuals came from two families who were attempting to cross into the United States illegally.

title: Sikh, Christian die in targeted killings in Pakistan’s NW
description: Pakistani police say a Sikh and a Christian have been shot dead in separate targeted attacks in the northwest city of Peshawar

title: Pakistani army says 4 troops killed by Iran-based militants
description: The Pakistani army says four of its soldiers were killed in a militant attack by Iran-based fighters

title: Syria's FM visits Egypt in step toward restoring ties
description: Syria’s chief diplomat is in Egypt today in a step toward normalizing ties between the two countries

title: Chaplains made part of Ukraine's military as war drags on
description: The first group of chaplains to join the Ukrainian military’s command structure has graduated

title: Taliban close women-run Afghan station for playing music
description: A Taliban official says a women-run radio station in Afghanistan’s northeast was closed for playing music during the holy month of Ramadan

title: Fatal fire complicates border city's tensions with migrants
description: Tensions have simmered between migrants and residents in Mexican border cities for years, with camps set up near crossings by those who can’t afford housing or who cling to hopes the U.S. will suddenly admit them

title: Norwegian Arctic area to be evacuated due deadly avalanches
description: Norwegian authorities say they plan to evacuate an area in northern Norway where avalanches and landslides have killed four people

title: Pakistani police arrest 8 after deadly Ramadan food stampede
description: Pakistani police say they have arrested eight people following a deadly Ramadan stampede in the southern city of Karachi

title: Pope Francis leaves hospital; 'Still alive,' he quips
description: Pope Francis has been discharged from the Rome hospital where he was treated for bronchitis

title: 350 million are ‘marching toward hunger,’ says outgoing U.N. food chief
description: World Food Program head David Beasley says climate change and the Ukraine war are partly to blame for worsening hunger. Cindy McCain replaces him this month.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russia takes U.N. Security Council presidency; calls mount for release of U.S. reporter
description: The White House said this week that Russia has "no place on the U.N. Security Council” but added there is no feasible pathway to change Moscow's status.
